(=
Ichneumon exarator Linnaeus, 1758
), by monotypy.

Spathius
is one of the largest genera of the subfamily Doryctinae , including over 450 described and a vast number of undescribed species (
Zaldívar-Riverón et al. 2018
). This genus is widely distributed in the five continents, although most of its species richness is concentrated in the Afrotropical and Oriental regions (with more than 350 described species).

The genus
Spathius
has not previously been recorded for the Arabian Peninsula, in spite of its intermediate position between the Africa and Oriental Asia – with both being the most species rich continents for the genus.

4. Hypoclypeal depression large and distinctly transverse, its width about twice distance from depression to eye ( Fig. 22B ). First (r) and second (3-SR) radial abscissae of fore wing forming almost single line. Parallel vein (CU1a) not interstitial, arising from anterior third of the vein (3-CU1) closed brachial (subdiscal) cell distally ( Fig. 23A ). Petiole long, its length 2.6–2.9 times posterior width, 1.8–2.0 times length of propodeum ( Fig. 23B–C ).
